item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell conditionally reinstates Michael Vick
item.description: Michael Vick was conditionally reinstated by NFL commissioner Roger Goodell on Monday and could play in regular season games as early as October.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Sources: Pete Rose's status the same, despite report
item.description: Pete Rose's status with baseball remains the same, despite a report that Bud Selig is "seriously considering" reinstatement of the hits king.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Manhattan district attorney wants Plaxico Burress in jail 'by trial or plea'
item.description: Manhattan's district attorney says he wants Giants wide receiver Plaxico Burress to serve time in prison, the New York Post reported.

item.dc:creator: Jayson Stark
item.title: Source: Toronto Blue Jays, Philadelphia Phillies trade talks over Roy Halladay 'not going well'
item.description: The Blue Jays and Phillies continue to talk about a deal that would send Roy Halladay to Philadelphia. But those talks are "not going well," one source with knowledge of the discussions told ESPN.com.

item.dc:creator: Shaun Assael
item.title: Second man claims ex-Indianapolis Colts WR Marvin Harrison shot him
item.description: A second man has filed suit against Marvin Harrison over a 2008 shooting.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Dwyane Wade of the Miami Heat continues recruitment of Lamar Odom in LA
item.description: Dwyane Wade announced via his Twitter account late Sunday night that he has flown to Los Angeles to bring Lamar Odom back to the Heat.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Bernazard, New York Mets executive, reportedly fired by New York Mets
item.description: Omar Minaya fired a team executive Monday for a series of blowups, then openly questioned the motives of a local beat writer.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Sources: Charlotte Bobcats, New Orleans Hornets talk Tyson Chandler for Emeka Okafor
item.description: Sources say the Bobcats and Hornets are in talks to trade Tyson Chandler for Emeka Okafor.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Brandon Marshall reports to Denver Broncos training camp
item.description: Brandon Marshall reported to the first day of the Broncos' training camp on Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: BCS changes open Rose Bowl bids to outsiders
item.description: Big Ten commissioner Jim Delany says some tweaking to the Bowl Championship Series rules has given greater access to the Rose Bowl to teams from outside the six conferences with automatic BCS bids -- such as Utah.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Ferrari's Felipe Massa awake, talking to family, doctor says
item.description: A doctor says Felipe Massa's life is no longer in danger, but that the Ferrari driver sustained an eye injury in his crash which could affect his future in Formula One.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: World championships: Aaron Peirsol ousted of signature event in world championships heat
item.description: Aaron Peirsol was stunningly knocked out of in the 100-meter backstroke semifinals Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Parker of the San Antonio Spurs injures ankle and thigh
item.description: Spurs guard Tony Parker has a sprained ankle and injured thigh after colliding with an Austrian player during a recent basketball game.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bobby Valentine says he won't stay with Chiba Lotte Marines
item.description: Bobby Valentine says he won't be back with the Chiba Lotte Marines next season even as the Japanese team's fans lobby management to keep him.

item.dc:creator: ESPNChicago.com
item.title: Fighting Illini football coach Ron Zook would like to play Northwestern at Wrigley Field
item.description: Fighting Illini football coach Ron Zook would like to play Northwestern at Wrigley Field.
